events.message: The applicant submitted the loan application to cover medical expenses incurred recently, providing initial personal details and loan amount requested.
Based on the purpose description mentioning medical expenses, the application was categorised under Personal Loan for further processing and review.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to handle the case to ensure a timely and thorough assessment of the applicant’s medical loan needs.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the documents submitted with the application to verify eligibility criteria and completeness.
Additional documents, including recent medical bills and proof of income, were requested from the applicant to support verification efforts.
The applicant promptly submitted the requested medical invoices along with employment verification and bank statements for review.
A standard credit check was conducted, revealing a stable credit history with no recent defaults or late payments.
Risk assessment was completed based on credit report, income-to-debt ratio, and loan purpose, indicating moderate risk.
A loan offer outlining interest rates, repayment schedule, and terms was presented to the applicant for consideration and approval.
The applicant responded with questions about repayment flexibility and requested clarification on early repayment penalties.
Due to the applicant’s inquiries, the application was escalated to senior loan management to consider tailored repayment options.
Following escalation review, the loan application was approved with an adjusted repayment plan to accommodate the applicant’s concerns.
The approved loan amount was successfully disbursed to the applicant’s bank account to cover the anticipated medical expenses.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant is satisfied with the loan terms and to answer any further questions.
The loan file was officially closed after confirming all funding and follow-up procedures were completed satisfactorily.
